meanings.definition: To survive from season to season
meanings.sent1: The flowers perennate in our garden, coming back each spring.
meanings.sent2: The hardy tree perennates through harsh winters without any issues.
meanings.sent3: The resilient plant decided to perennate through all the weather changes, never giving up.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening seemed to perennate endlessly, like a perennial flower.
meanings.sent5: The idea of hope perennating in his heart kept him going through tough times.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be active for an indefinitely long time
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins perennate as a reminder of the past civilizations.
meanings.sent2: His legacy will perennate for generations to come.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the ghost in the old house seemed to perennate in the small town.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song perennated in her mind, playing on repeat.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of storytelling perennates in their family, passed down through the years.

meanings.definition: To produce new growth each year
meanings.sent1: The deciduous trees perennate by shedding their leaves in the fall and growing new ones in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The strawberry plants perennate by sending out runners and producing fresh berries annually.
meanings.sent3: The farmer's crops perennated with bountiful harvests year after year.
meanings.sent4: The vineyard perennated with lush grapes, yielding a rich harvest every season.
meanings.sent5: The garden perennated with colorful blooms, bringing joy to all who passed by.
